Package com.shortn.sally.interfacing

Class ShellVerb

java.lang.Object
com.shortn.sally.interfacing.ShellVerb
All Implemented Interfaces:
Supplier<String>
Direct Known Subclasses:
VerbTest
public abstract class ShellVerb extends Object implements Supplier<String>
Provides the primary operation and structure for any shell commands (referred to as verbs).

The values inherited from this class include a String to store the help documentation, and a Map to store the options accepted by the verb. The map of options links a string (what is typed after a - in the command) to a setter method for one of the verbs values. The link to the setter method is specified via a lambda function. This class also includes protected methods to easily pass string values into the needed primitive types for the map, all implementers of the ObjectConverter interface.

Every extending class defined by a user should specify the needed options as primitive values of the class, along with the appropriate getter and setter methods.

Each verb should be triggered by the call method. This accepts a map of string option names to the appropriate string value specified by the user and converts them via the optionMap methods. By referencing those methods kept in the optionMap the call method gets the class values in the proper state before calling the user specified get method. The get method specified by the user should simply directly reference / use the class values they created, and return a String value to be printed to the console upon completion of the action. The get method should only be used when referenced within the call method.

  • Constructor Details

    • ShellVerb

      public ShellVerb(String help)
      Constructs a new ShellVerb with the specified help documentation, and an empty optionMap.

      Inheriting classes should send their desired help docs via the super constructor, and populate the optionMap using the addOption method.

      Parameters:
      help - String formatted to document what the verb and its options do.
      See Also:
      • addOption(String, Consumer)

  • Method Details

    • getHelp

      public String getHelp()
      Returns the formatted String documenting what the verb and its options do.
      Returns:
      String value stored in the help field.

    • setHelp

      public void setHelp(String help)
      Specifies a new value for the help field to document the verb and option usage.
      Parameters:
      help - String formatted to document what the verb and its options do.

    • getOptionMap

      public Map<String,Consumer<String>> getOptionMap()
      Returns an immutable copy of the optionMap field to iterate through and run methods from.
      Returns:
      Map immutable copy of the optionMap variable.

    • setOptionMap

      public void setOptionMap(Map<String,Consumer<String>> options)
      Specifies a new value for the optionMap field to link string input to class setter methods.

      The String key should match what the shell user will enter to specify a verb option. The Consumer value should be specified as a lambda function converting a String value into the appropriate setter method for one of this class' variables.

      Parameters:
      options - Map a preset Map linking string values to this class' setter methods
      See Also:
      • convertInt(String)
      • convertDouble(String)

    • addOption

      public ShellVerb addOption(String key, Consumer<String> value)
      Adds a new mapping of a String key to a Consumer setter method for this class' variables. Method calls can be chained as it returns a reference to the current object once run.
      Parameters:
      key - String that will be entered by a user to specify a verb option.
      value - Consumer method, specified as a lambda function to pass a converted String value into the appropriate setter method for one of this class's variables.
      Returns:
      ShellVerb reference to the current object. Allows multiple method calls to be chained.
      See Also:
      • convertInt(String)
      • convertDouble(String)

    • call

      public static final <T extends ShellVerb> String call(Map<String,String> values, T verb)
      Used to both set this class' local variables and run the user specified get function based on them. When entering a value for the verb parameter you should use a new declaration of a specific ShellVerb subclass.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Any class inheriting from the ShellVerb class. This will be a user-defined verb with its own local variables and defined get method to perform whatever action is needed.
      Parameters:
      values - Map linking the option name key to the user specified value.
      verb - New instance of T to be newly instantiated with each method call and have its optionMap checked against and executed from.
      Returns:
      String to be returned to the console stating the execution status or success.

    • convertInt

      protected static final int convertInt(String s)
      Used to convert a String value entered at the command line into an integer value for use by the get() method. Recommended use is in the optionMap as part of a lambda function to set a new local value for this class.
      Parameters:
      s - String value entered by the user in the command line to be converted.
      Returns:
      int value derived from the entered string.
      See Also:
      • ObjectConverter
      • ObjectConverter.convert(Object, Function)

    • convertDouble

      protected static final double convertDouble(String s)
      Used to convert a String value entered at the command line into a double value for use by the get() method. Recommended use is in the optionMap as part of a lambda function to set a new local value for this class.
      Parameters:
      s - String value entered by the user in the command line to be converted.
      Returns:
      double value derived from the entered string.
      See Also:
      • ObjectConverter
      • ObjectConverter.convert(Object, Function)
